poem:
Title: "Dusk of Dignity"

Beneath the shadow of progress,
in the quiet of life's conjecture,
Nurses, workers, souls in toil,
Caught in the crosshairs of departure.

Debt's blind spot, a tightening snare,
Rising rents, unspoken despair. 
Foolhardy youth in ceaseless plight,
Chasing dreams in the neon light. 

Breathtaking dawn, we glimpse,
But in our tired eyes - a wince,
A lament for truth's surrender,
To the cold machinery of tender.
